tips: The midpoint formula works for any two points, regardless of their position on the coordinate plane
Remember to add coordinates first, then divide by 2 - don't divide each coordinate separately
Midpoints of negative coordinates follow the same formula - just be careful with signs
The midpoint is always exactly halfway between the two original points
You can verify your answer by checking that the distance from each original point to the midpoint is equal
For fractions, convert to decimals or find a common denominator for easier calculation
